document.title: South Carolina College- and Career-Ready Standards for English Language Arts

482A462E05BA492693DAD74BCC5DD8AB.description: Employ repetitive language, onomatopoeia, and/or alliteration to impact the audience.

B482D233C0FC47439D0F3E3D5CD7F44C.description: Use voice inflection, expression, rhythm, and rhyme, when presenting poems, short stories, role-plays, or songs.

8607D04C7A7F4391B2D17CC0D14874E8.description: Incorporate craft techniques to engage and impact audience and convey messages.

F7D6599003D34F139AA982C64F00152C.description: Identify when the speaker uses intonation and word stress.

143DD152FC284E2A9B63D40DB943C6BF.description: Identify the introduction and conclusion of a presentation.

0F1EF322351A4A02A7F13E54A3407AB0.description: Critique how a speaker addresses content and uses stylistic and structural craft techniques to inform, engage, and impact audiences.

ADC2EF0B233E492685CD84EC9783A6D2.description: Use appropriate props, images, or illustrations to support verbal communication.

8BE9FFA21D2846359CBB3CB77D6A1303.description: Explore how ideas and topics are depicted in a variety of media and formats.

260E920E9BFE41E59E6CD084E26FC2BC.description: Communicate information through strategic use of multiple modalities and multimedia to enrich understanding when presenting ideas and information.

244FA5D37D60411AA76AF17A8F326C10.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research exploring a variety of texts; express opinions and talk about findings.

65A5FDE8269A4D88831E337B20906D2D.description: With guidance and support, recall information from experiences or gather information from sources to ask and answer questions.

4D3F9C1E1EF849ADABA0F9FE40FB62AE.description: Articulate ideas, claims, and perspectives in a logical sequence using information, findings, and credible evidence from sources.

85FE762331C94D0187FC3353212690D4.description: Explain personal ideas and build on the ideas of others by responding and relating to comments made.

C12A47D4A705470393A725C5FD61FE29.description: Participate in conversations with varied partners about focused grade level topics and texts in small and large groups.

E7743C66011C4A5C91592442F8540D83.description: Practice verbal and nonverbal techniques including volume and tone, eye contact, facial expressions, and posture.

85E412296F8D470C8B8E4A1972B557F7.description: Practice the skills of taking turns, listening to others, and speaking clearly.

77801B59C453445083A33DC81F1D86B4.description: Explore and create meaning through play, conversation, drama, and story-telling.

E698BDB8E89141E2947A74D9A7EEC641.description: Interact with others to explore ideas and concepts, communicate meaning, and develop logical interpretations through collaborative conversations; build upon the ideas of others to clearly express one's own views while respecting diverse perspectives.

513887D258C942F19A0CB8A5865CC83A.description: Locate letter keys on an electronic device.

7414C0A51322443E8AABD476052B818B.description: Recognize that print moves from left to right and that there are spaces between words.

8FC6B40A4BD149DB95C357C617D8F3C2.description: With guidance and support, write routinely and persevere in writing tasks for a variety of purposes and audiences.

F8C83013B69E449EAC54376C8765B8F8.description: Write independently, legibly, and routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences over short and extended time frames.

64F44A8A47C84C86BA6B29963CDCAB5E.description: Consult print and multimedia resources to check and correct spellings.

FE96DEEBE6A84901B2C6E077413A2693.description: Write letter(s) for familiar consonant and vowel sounds.

94BF044F44D7438A818D790AEF8364E9.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

A5680D6455214566AF92FDEFE4D38C8A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6C67E2AEDE54438CAB26887AD02B2979.description: With guidance and support, use conjunctions.

52EF730F6D104F1B933D003E68165411.description: With guidance and support, use prepositional phrases.

DF05B0F81C4D4A0A9466DADF3D304852.description: With guidance and support, use adjectives.

1FA3E0E9CDB24965B82DF6DFED1A0FDF.description: With guidance and support, use verbs.

9FAD9A6A810C469EABFB9A2267C3B282.description: With guidance and support, understand and use interrogatives.

909B467558244F82B98CE202E035D113.description: With guidance and support, form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.

4B3CAF0B4D074405837A1F956DA694FF.description: With guidance and support, use nouns.

A77377EEBEB0446FB5BBAA76058003D3.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing and speaking.

6AC1F40C1A0A41B4AB780C2D15A1A85C.description: With guidance and support, plan, revise, and edit building on personal ideas and the ideas of others to strengthen writing.

EF75B8DC20A7459EA0BA7897466DF73D.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, to tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and to provide a reaction to what happened.

AAC69E5635044CF0BE7EDD6B56C2BFBA.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

BF3A6103672F4BF290CE5A61B0052063.description: With guidance and support, plan, revise, and edit building on personal ideas and the ideas of others to strengthen writing.

5B659641A5814392B93E415C36E66D68.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts that name and supply information about the topic.

B903F3EB5C734665B7F45ED6757C534D.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

D3255C2957234B338CB44A49698EEF03.description: With guidance and support, plan, revise, and edit building on personal ideas and the ideas of others to strengthen writing.

09DDB759B6B74A9FAAC5073AA6FE2CC6.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to state the topic and communicate an opinion about it.

9673046DA31D4B5F895C622B6A2AFA89.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

287BC3D1CC5044BA9BB048BE10E6984E.description: Read and respond according to task and purpose to become self-directed, critical readers and thinkers.

A3CE1FC29516400BA2C2E88089A8F29E.description: Read independently for sustained periods of time.

E57BA9B3B3FF4783A7BAFF7821119A43.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and understanding.

D87E09785DB9433599A15869EC26A216.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and building stamina; reflect and respond to increasingly complex text over time.

66FC6AC9D19D489196F831C61CE68D07.description: With guidance and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support a position.

9960BDE463404FDAAEE45AB6AD61213F.description: With guidance and support, explore informational text structures within texts heard or read.

3E582DDBC5D2494B96079A90BCB463DD.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in print and multimedia texts to craft informational and argument writing.

91BC7D49567A4D7CB67D0C113152898D.description: Identify the author and illustrator and define the role of each.

52ED6EDA05EF47AC9339D29969E747DC.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author's choice of purpose and perspective shapes content, meaning, and style.

FF736DD5071843979BE4765212B79C64.description: With guidance and support, use words and phrases acquired through talk and text; explore nuances of words and phrases.

9888F5DB9E274327A7E23290085EEA0B.description: With guidance and support, use print and multimedia resources to explore word relationships and meanings.

F8530D5B6FDB4EDAB9291A63059286DA.description: With guidance and support, use inflectional endings and affixes to determine the meaning of unknown words.

1F0395BEE3CD4F94A3712B1F25D8BDB2.description: With guidance and support, identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately.

52021493DC0D493582EF61F2B0FBEF59.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions about known and unknown words.

67F606592C3E494D8D960DD75337624D.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine and deepen the meaning of known, unknown, and multiple-meaning words, phrases, and jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

04DF0C3241FC4A599E6A824B3EECB21A.description: With guidance and support, use front cover, title page, illustrations/photographs, fonts, glossary, and table of contents to locate and describe key facts or information; describe the relationship between these features and the text.

90EB32CDDD764C72AD4F26509D9FED3F.description: With guidance and support, identify words, phrases, illustrations, and photographs used to provide information.

CE850279BCDF4CA9BBAC4A9E096908C3.description: Interpret and analyze the author's use of words, phrases, text features, conventions, and structures, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

1D10441D82974B3196DA325FE3CFE763.description: With guidance and support, compare topics or ideas within a thematic or author study heard, read, or viewed.

9C930B26BC9646A8923D96577A67D1BE.description: Research events, topics, ideas, or concepts through multiple media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities.

7BBACD0512234A9893B202FF71F0B24A.description: With guidance and support, retell the central idea and identify key details to summarize a text heard, read, or viewed.

7CA391C1F1084A478D6B100C921E1AD4.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of central ideas.

BA06A560C080461694005C3FA3B9820D.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions to make predictions using prior knowledge, pictures, illustrations, title, and information about author and illustrator.

711C1B78C17D4713B6F0EF82E36C1F30.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer who, what, when, where, why, and how questions about a text; refer to key details to make inferences and draw conclusions in texts heard or read.

A4707131CA8846C9ACDB45558908EFAB.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing, synthesizing, providing evidence, and investigating multiple interpretations.

0B04A4EFA6D54CE9926AF13068BDA5C2.description: Use picture cues to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding.

0F028603FEC248AAB99F0620068D2907.description: Read emergent texts orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

A59A4D106F6C465CAAE65AD9E5D84A5D.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

8A8B94CECA9F40B2B30548EBB1840A6D.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

68D30538CDF048F5ADA41AB2B92ECCCA.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled consonant-vowel-consonant-patterned words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

F29B0CAD33C54469AFEDEBC5058E775C.description: Associate long and short sounds of the five major vowels with their common spellings.

0D7185EDC5FC4BC8A777EBA0C752E494.description: Produce one-to-one letter-sound correspondences for each consonant.

34BEF2E8DBDF4505824F6E978A9B045F.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills when decoding words.

81DE82861F944604ABC6305743990C72.description: Add or substitute individual sounds in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

7B1DB5C0A76E4D26A240569EC278FCD0.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial, and final sounds in a three-phoneme word.

F79CA84A71694A39B5EFCFC30AD423A7.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

0197E9E6376F466787FAE6EBE5A5F72A.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

3B7D3A3F6C8643AD830BBED9ABCE2F89.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds.

D5F3D509EF7F4C8EB4D9461B65E93B3C.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

7DAC888CF47440CA96444746ABC32C95.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

221F4AEAC8A04B9D9C5AE38AB20A520B.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

3F3F5FCDA04C45F8AFEB6450FF58A851.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and front to back.

EC95C7633C4143239AC3BF07B5FAFA4C.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

6E3F3FF8423F418E9CFA5F2043254F7C.description: Read and respond according to task and purpose to become self-directed, critical readers and thinkers.

34DCCFFE0ECC41D5B58A36307F9BF681.description: Read independently for sustained periods of time to build stamina.

0769BCA096AC49CF8D389F5A5FDD8A83.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and understanding.

302EC222276E4BE3A8040DBFE49A647C.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and building stamina; reflect and respond to increasingly complex text over time.

7FB6EBBC530F428FB616FF3299B03B73.description: Recognize the crafted text structure of recurring phrases.

DB48CC39AA7E4F5BA5887A9772C8E4EE.description: Recognize and sort types of literary texts.

9DF8D1D035BE46568301A509E4DC4DC5.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in print and multimedia texts to shape meaning and impact the reader.

0F0CEB2559BD468CA1D5D07AC331E440.description: Identify who is telling the story, the narrator or characters.

6A9A4362E80F40D7915BCA57FF22388B.description: Identify the author and illustrator and define the role of each.

68C719FC322C41FFB41DF3FD5FDAF1E9.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author's choice of point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes content, meaning, and style.

BF5E1ED55B0344A693C2C901E78F41BB.description: With guidance and support, use words and phrases acquired through talk and text; explore nuances of words and phrases.

0705F108DF11438AA54BD1BED07E8ED7.description: With guidance and support, use print and multimedia resources to explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

3FAE4195E3074D09B6385AFDA3949716.description: With guidance and support, identify the individual words used to form a compound word.

FC8A13103480424AA7848B2CEB4BBD80.description: With guidance and support, use inflectional endings and affixes to determine the meaning of unknown words.

7578C59DF62D451CB6A1FCD585F7B884.description: With guidance and support, identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately.

799792D531704BF3AA6AE35F60A9BB28.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions about known and unknown words.

852A619E3F79459794632251C5963FDA.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine and deepen the meaning of known, unknown, and multiple-meaning words, phrases, and jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

03565267C6964764BA7316ACE5C14D45.description: With guidance and support, identify how an author's choice of words, phrases, conventions, and illustrations suggest feelings, appeal to the senses, and contribute to meaning.

99717819F1B74791AAE1E1A3CAB69457.description: With guidance and support, identify the literary devices of repetitive language and the sound devices of rhyme, onomatopoeia, and alliteration; identify when the author uses each.

DBA6AE53804E47989F3B8C7A7C5555C9.description: Interpret and analyze the author's use of words, phrases, and conventions, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

FBB057B0B78748278EA50C80568398CD.description: identify the cause of an event.

E0B117568750409F8C308D3BF71A47F0.description: identify the problem and solution; and

1537AC60914A411D8CFAA6B488D3534B.description: compare characters' experiences to those of the reader;

58B615F5C6C548749A8F27D8DC18B907.description: With guidance and support, read or listen closely to:

3467389296BC467D8D570940ABF8732A.description: Analyze characters, settings, events, and ideas as they develop and interact within a particular context.

FFCD03747D654057B3A7CAEE0175EF79.description: Read or listen closely to compare familiar texts.

2870468DE74345A3A52799AC89B4F79C.description: With guidance and support, retell a familiar text; identify beginning, middle, and end in a text heard or read.

888EEFEF5B6C415CBBC0CD808C365411.description: Analyze the relationship among ideas, themes, or topics in multiple media and formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities.

FD420C01F62047C6951323C61C0A5943.description: Describe the relationship between illustrations and the text.

4173C8A669A04F33A42CA13E95C95349.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of thematic development.

FF4E0DF5D8C94E82A0CC028725F21662.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions to make predictions using prior knowledge, pictures, illustrations, title, and information about author and illustrator.

D10BE1D0188F411EAE932520691BF40B.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer who, what, when, where, why, and how questions about a text; refer to key details to make inferences and draw conclusions in texts heard or read.

DCB94F33B9F84731A7DB44B6CB0E3298.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing, synthesizing, providing evidence, and investigating multiple interpretations.

79DDA166B3954EDDA804319EE50103AD.description: Use picture cues to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding.

F2AF6D26E7714D4CBFA24D4ABA50DA10.description: Read emergent texts orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

B01CC36A506E41E6B1548E52EA8CD07F.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

6CECC5361E4748448544C167EC65AF51.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

61F514B9AE2C4A6B8B6BB06CB148EAAF.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled consonant-vowel-consonant-patterned words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

722EB56851534A84B6C05BF5880948B3.description: Associate long and short sounds of the five major vowels with their common spellings.

E4F28933D62F469BA6B3F41EF2D087B4.description: Produce one-to-one letter-sound correspondences for each consonant.

67862AD1F6CB439D89A6C1ED96266744.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills when decoding words.

5455FE55A2FA40E1B5A8FCE0E877C472.description: Add or substitute individual sounds in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

AF8E82818E0A473DBC1B91DA9872AC75.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial, and final sounds in a three-phoneme word.

4872EDEA83E8496EA417B6B55599ABB4.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

FC0B116086714F6F9E5C499065C53443.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

2C4F5FBE3A8F42709CCFD27562014DA8.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds.

9D158C3CFB7740BBBE6AC6DE6AA9B253.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

496D137F212D4C6591F9A12173728266.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

77A8210B6B574B5BB0E397055179A429.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

01FBBF89F65641629B34A34EC8BECA87.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and front to back.

4BE9D26BAD2B4A7FA1676930C9C2BACD.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

C5954F64809A43C38ED07BB45D2A888D.description: With guidance and support monitor and assess learning to guide inquiry

5F5E6C1170D6435884BCD68C5DAB2749.description: With guidance and support, recognize the value of individual and collective thinking.

79FE1A8234E24E3BA73F8295B9096D65.description: Reflect throughout the inquiry process to assess metacognition, broaden understanding, and guide actions, individually and collaboratively.

D3E51E53ABDA4714AEF36D5AC92C2ACA.description: With guidance and support, reflect on findings.

EC6F1869857D44D186595F6812ADE4F0.description: With guidance and support, use tools to communicate findings.

1CC1386D4C14431185EE3F9AD8E23797.description: With guidance and support, discover relationships and patterns during the inquiry process.

6977DACE08F247959B88395D31DBFAA9.description: Synthesize information to share learning and/or take action.

E30431499FAF4B069D046D264C124BB4.description: With guidance and support, select information, revise ideas, and record and communicate findings.

FE9F843030E646DD9DB572662EA6086E.description: With guidance and support, develop a plan of action for collecting information from multiple sources through play, sensory observation, texts, websites, and conversations with adults/peers.

5C99AF9126AB48EF975E8D6B41F42408.description: Construct knowledge, applying disciplinary concepts and tools, to build deeper understanding of the world through exploration, collaboration, and analysis.

EF841675F2354F9E9676F686C93D4C03.description: With guidance and support, engage in daily explorations of texts to make connections to personal experiences, other texts, or the environment.

8880D60F3491431DA08640AB089283E1.description: Transact with texts to formulate questions, propose explanations, and consider alternative views and multiple perspectives.

721C6F9E93EE44D088C4863A6B590E1D.description: Engage in daily opportunities for play and exploration to foster a sense of curiosity, develop the disposition of inquisitiveness, and begin to verbally articulate "I wonders" about ideas of interest.

E4744759A5514BECB7B6DE723706F79D.description: Formulate relevant, self-generated questions based on interests and/or needs that can be investigated.
